Geoffrey Exoo writes:

I suggest using Cayley tournaments arising from
nonabelian groups of order pq, where p and q are odd primes with
q mod p = 1.  They seem to work fairly well. 

Here's an example for the nonabelian group of order
111 = 3 * 37.  There appears to be no acyclic subgraph
of order 11?  (Later note: Exoo rechecked and confirmed.)
If so, that proves that R(11) > 111,
a new record lower bound:

111x111 Adjacency matrix (please view on wide screen):

000110110101100001010111101000110000010001110010000111010111011111100001011101101100000001100111100001101101011
100001111111001000001001011101011011110001101000100110010000001110010011010101000101011100110011111111000100110
